alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 7:47PM CDT until July 05 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN COOK COUNTY... At 747 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate that the heaviest rainfall has moved east out of Cook County, with lighter rainfall continuing. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches have been observed so far, with numerous reports of flooded roadways across the area. Flooded roadways will be slow to recede over the next few hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Berwyn, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Oak Park, Chicago Midway Airport. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
